alert.note: Alert for Richland (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 05 at 6:09PM EDT until April 05 at 8:30PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central South Carolina, including the following counties, Aiken, Calhoun, Clarendon, Fairfield, Kershaw, Lee, Lexington, Newberry, Orangeburg, Richland and Sumter. * WHEN...Until 800 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 608 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. Some areas have already experienced flooding this afternoon. The additional rain will result in additional areas of minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Columbia, Sumter, Lexington, West Columbia, Cayce, Irmo, Forest Acres, Camden, Batesburg-Leesville, Winnsboro, Bishopville, Springdale, McEntire Air Base, Dentsville, St. Andrews, Lake Wateree Dam, Shaw Air Base, Oak Grove, Highway 6 at Lake Murray Dam and Red Bank. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 126 between mile markers 0 and 3. Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 38 and 126. Interstate 77 between mile markers 0 and 44. Interstate 26 between mile markers 91 and 138. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Most flooding deaths occur in vehicles. Never drive through a flooded roadway or around barricades. Turn around, don`t drown. Minor flooding will occur in the Five Points area extending downstream along Rocky Branch Creek. This includes Maxcy Gregg Park, areas of the USC campus along the creek, the intersection at Pickens and Blossom, the intersection at Whaley and Main and areas of the Olympia neighborhood along the creek. Flooded roadways are nearly impossible to see at night. Avoid traveling in the warned area. Turn around, don`t drown. Report any flooding directly to the Columbia National Weather Service at 803 234 4115 when it is safe to do so. You can also send reports by Facebook or Twitter to NWSColumbia or by e-mail at NWS.Columbia@noaa.gov.
